means: 长时间或辛苦地工作( toil的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Nora toils away serving burgers at the local cafe.
sentence.Network_cn: 诺拉在当地小餐馆干着一份为客人端送汉堡包的辛苦活儿。

sentence.Network_en: It did not declare him to be still in Mrs. Dorset's toils.
sentence.Network_cn: 这并不表明他仍陷于多赛特夫人的情网.

sentence.Network_en: The thief was caught in the toils of law.

PerfectNetExp.abs: thanks largely to baroque regulation , half the force toils in the informal economy , unable to reap the productivity gains that come from technology and greater scale .多亏了巴洛克式管理制度，一半的劳动力在非正规经济中做苦力，无法获得由于技术提高和大规模生产而产生的收益。

list.abs: toil at 苦干toil on 艰苦工作toil 辛苦
Tohalon 特爱龙高强力醋酯短纤维toile bizonne 本色亚麻织物toile bleue 蓝色细亚麻布

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (denoting a net into which a hunted quarry is driven): plural of toil, from Old French toile 'net, trap' (see toile)

entry.def: When people toil, they work very hard doing unpleasant or tiring tasks.

example.ex: People who toiled in dim, dank factories were too exhausted to enjoy their family life...
example.tran: 在昏暗潮湿的工厂辛苦劳作的人们累得无力再去享受家庭生活。
工人们长时间辛苦劳动。

entry.tran: (通常指因疲倦而)费劲地行走，艰难地行动
entry.def: If you toil somewhere, you move there slowly and with difficulty, usually because you are very tired.

example.ex: Arnold had his head down, gasping as he toiled up the hill.
example.tran: 阿诺德垂着头，一边费劲地往山上爬一边气喘吁吁。

entry.def: Toil is unpleasant work that is very tiring physically.

auth_sentence.content: Soldiers in the toils of civilian law for thefts.

auth_sentence.content: He toils without the hope of mural or civick garlands.
